reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights here while visiting the Kona side of the Big Island. Had the closest room to the pool on the second floor. It was wonderful. While on the Big Island I have found you spend most of your time away from the hotel anyway ( or at least your should be out exploring!) This was a perfect place to have a nice breakfast or return after a day of adventures and fall asleep to the waves. Can not beat the place for price and location. Staff is friendly and stays out of your way. Its a great piece of what i deam old school Hawaii/mom and pop hotels that you do not see anymore. Will be staying again FOR SURE!
reviews.title: All you need!

reviews.text: We arrived late and took the last room - top floor, nearest the road but with sea views. My initial concern was that the traffic noise would be too loud but in the end, the crashing waves actually kept me awake most of the night instead. However, my partner loves the sound of crashing waves!
reviews.title: Great value but needs modernising

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large, even with a kitchen. Everything was clean and works fine but it does look outdated.
reviews.title: Great Value and Great View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was quite disappointing, compared to what we'd had in other places on the Big Island. You get a choice of bagels, some pastries and some juice but the coffee was poor.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a small pool too but the best thing about this hotel are the sea views. If you can put up with the loud wave noises, it's excellent value. Don't stay here if you want a modern, contemporary environment.
reviews.title: Great little budget hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really lovely 3 nights here back in June. After spending 5 nights in a fairly noisy hotel in the bustling Waikiki, it was a delight to be here.
reviews.title: Great value, a little gem

likes.liked: — Watching the tropical fish from the balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had character, plenty of space & a great view. There's no TV, but when you can virtually dry water snorkell by looking down into the sea from your balcony, who needs a tv?
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are friendly & although it's a bit of a walk into Kona town, we thought it was excellent value.
reviews.title: Great Value If you like low key

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only criticism? Here, like most other places in the US seems to pay no regard to recycling & trying to save the planet. The buffet breakfast was provided on paper plates, with plastic cutlery & styrofoam cups. I know they're trying to save on washing up, but I couldn't help but be shocked at the wastefulness of this. At least recycle the paper plates & swap the coffee cups for either cardboard cups or proper cups. The US is too big a country to have terrible habits like this - we saw this type of thing almost everywhere we stayed.
reviews.title: Good price and good location

likes.disliked: — When I got fussed at for an honest mistake.

reviews.title: Not ripped off
reviews.text: They say that you can't get something for nothing, but Kona Tiki comes close.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week's vacation in Hawaii where we stayed at the Kona Tiki. This is a great little place - we would be happy to stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it (with the 'noise caveat' below). It was pretty much exactly as described by other reviewers so I won't go into detail on what has already been said. Rather, I'll just elaborate a bit on a few points...
reviews.title: A Hotel With Personality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The room - stayed in a non-kitchen unit in the middle of the 2nd floor. We could hear the road noise when the surf was quieter but it was pretty much drowned out at night. We loved sitting on the balcony and watching the waves come crashing in. The room was clean with a twin bed and a double bed. The bathroom was small but the shower was bigger than we expected. There was a small refrigerator and a sign indicating that since it is a non-kitchen unit, "no electrical appliances of any kind could be used"....so if you're planning to bring your mini-blender to whip up some pina coladas....probably consider the kitchenette units. Also, they provide soap in the bathrooms but no shampoo, so come prepared.
reviews.title: Loved It! Difficult to pay, but Loved it!!

reviews.text: 2. The noise from the surf - if you have read the other reviews here, you know the noise from the surf is loud. When we initially read them, we couldn't help but be amused. We figured...how loud could it be? If anything, it was one of the things we were most looking forward to. Well, we learned. First, I will emphasize that we did get used to it. However, we think its only fair to try to give upcoming guests a realistic view of what to expect. This is not the soothing sound of waves gently breaking against the sand. Its more like the full surging power of the ocean crashing furiously against the rocks and wall...which in turn was amplified inside of the room. We were torn as to whether it was closer to the sound of a freight train outside our window all night or 747s taking off continuously. The doors/window do not block much (if any) of the noise - plus, with no a/c, shutting the windows also blocks out the breeze. The upside though - after the 2nd night, we had gotten used to it and had no problems sleeping the rest of the stay. Another plus to it is that it drowns out the road noise which would have been terrible if it weren't for the waves. So, in all, we'd still recommend it but if you are a light or sensitive sleeper, you may want to proceed with caution.
reviews.title: Quirky, a Bargain Hunter's Dream

likes.disliked: — Being asked to pay the small remaining balance in cash right at check in when we were going to be there 4 days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. The staff - the folks at the hotel were wonderful. Friendly and always around when we had a question. One thing we learned was that the actual owners are not onsite. Instead, they hire different folks to live onsite and manage the property for 3 month intervals. Given this, the managers you encounter during your visit may be completely different folks than those referenced in this or other reviews, so keep that in mind.
reviews.title: Excellent low-budget hotel right at the oceanfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. The weather - so this doesn't have too much to do with the hotel but just a warning to any of those heading to Kona in the near future....the volcano is causing a terrible amount of "vog" that is just hanging over Kona leaving it very gray and cloudy. It's been that way for weeks now and no one knows when/if it will change. Unfortunately, most weather reports don't provide vog info so even when it was reported as clear skies and sunny, it was still gray and cloudy. We made the best of it though and had fun exploring other parts of the island in our attempts to find the sun!
reviews.title: "Ripped off"

reviews.text: We spent three nights in at the Kona Tiki (one in a standard room and two in a kitchenette). Overall, we were in Hawaii for 18 nights and this was the place we enjoyed the most. Originally we were at the Manago Hotel in Captain Cook, but found that to be to far from what we wanted to be doing in this area (see review of the Manago for comparison). When we decided to check out of the Manago, I had the Kona Tiki in my mind as a back up hotel. We drove to the hotel first thing in the AM, to see if we could get a room. We were told that they had an available room as someone did not show up, but they had someone on a waiting list before us. If that person did not take it, they would call us. Less than 15 minutes after we left, we got a call that we could have the room if we would be willing to change rooms during our stay. We agreed to it and told them we would be there in a couple of minutes. As we pulled into the parking lot, we saw another car leaving. The person who was on the waiting list and first said no, changed there mind and would take the room with the change. Luckily, since we agreed and said we would be right there, they told the other person the room was no longer available.
reviews.title: Aloha Spoken Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the negatives: there are only 15 rooms so it fills up fast. The bathrooms in both rooms we stayed in were small, in fact we joked that you had to back in. The parking lot was not big enough for 15 cars. In order to overcome this, the last two cars in parked right in the center of the lot and put their keys in a lock box. If someone wanted to leave before those cars had been moved, the owner takes the keys from the box and moves the cars so you can get yours out. They even block traffic with the last car, so you could get out easier. The last negative we found was that if you were a light sleeper, you might have a problem with the noise of the waves hitting the retaining wall out side your room. We had no problem with it, but talked with someone else who wears ear plugs at night.
reviews.title: Love this Hotel!
Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: Now for the positives: the location is perfect, both from ease to get to and surroundings. The ocean is close as you are going to find at any facility as are many ocean activities. From our lanai we could see both whales and surfers. In fact, it was the closest we came to someone surfing as he would surf right past our balcony. We got a lot of great pictures. The rooms were large, clean and had comfortable beds. We stayed in rooms at the opposite ends of the building (106 and 201). We did not notice road noise in 106, but did in 201, though the ocean helped to drown it out. Each room has a refrigerator and not just a pint sized one. The refrigerators were fairly decent in size, when compared with the ones in a normal hotel. If you are not in a kitchenette room, you could still cook as the hotel provided two small gas grills and two small charcoal grills. Since there are only 15 rooms, you get to meet and talk to other guests. Many of them when we were there had been coming for years and knew each other. That did not preclude them from inviting us to join them either for breakfast or an evening of watching the sunset and just visiting. We even got to light the torches they have on the property and to blow the conch shell prior to lighting each one (my wife could blow it, I couldn’t!). Speaking of breakfast, there was an ample breakfast of fruit, muffins and hot cinnamon buns (kept in a warming tray), in addition they had juice and Kona coffee also available. The owners and all the staff were friendly and helpful. I don’t remember everything they provided, but I know they provided beach towels and boogie boards.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, it was a great place to stay at a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Oceanfront on a Budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a gem! We loved the fact that it was no frills. The location is wonderful...each room has an ocean view and you can hear the waves at night.
reviews.title: Good value and location
